p: The most common among the pathogens was E. coli, which was identified in six samples (19.35%), followed by five (16.13%) samples with Streptococcus spp., while Staphylococcus spp. coagulase negative, Streptococcus uberis, Streptococcus dysgalactiae, Klebsiella oxytoca, and Enterobacter sakazakii were found in one sample each (3.23%) ( Figure 1).
